website_summaries.verdict: Philip's starter kit is an ideal match for many of the most popular home controllers on the market. Individual bulbs may seem expensive, but the technology is top notch. Deep color palette and variable white temperatures.
pros: Deep, vivid colors and several white hues to choose
Integrates well with most home controllers
Steady "on" maintains reliable contact with hub and apps
cons: Some lag time reported between command and actual activation
May not remember last settings before shutoff
Only equivalent to a 60 watt bulb, not very bright

customer_reviews.title: Need more purchasing options
customer_reviews.text: These lights are great. Pricey, but they're extremely cool. You'll use them every day and once you get them you'll want them in every major room of your house. Which brings me to my next point, why isn't there a way to buy them in packs without the bridge? The 3 pack is 135 with the bridge, the bulbs are 50 each. So it's cheaper to buy 3 lights WITH a bridge which is (allegedly) worth 60 dollars than it is to just buy 3 lights? And there are no light packs that don't include the bridge? I'd really like a 100-ish dollar pack of 3 that doesn't come with an extra thing I don't need.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: I kind of thought this was stupid. And yea
customer_reviews.text: It's pricey, but once you're in, you're in. I'm not going to lie. I kind of thought this was stupid. And yea, I rarely if ever use the color changing features. But telling Google to turn off, turn on, or change the brightness of my lights? Like my friend said, "You've turned your living room into a space ship". Plus with compatibility with IFTTT, you can program timers, even say... "turn on every day at sunset" and it will know when sunset is each day, and turn your lights on. I'm hooked on the convenience of this. Meet George Jetson!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Edit:  after exhausting all efforts to sustain color, I refuse to buy more bulbs. Will spend my money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the thought of color in my home and couldn't wait. But the underlying issue of turning back to dull white at less than 100% is such a huge disappointment. You can't use a color with the timer either. Same issue. I've used alexa commands and IIFT triggers and because the default is not 100% this is what I have to say to get it my color: Alexa, living room on Alexa, trigger living room blue Alexa, living room 100% Now that will stay all day if I use alexa commands to turn on and off but the next day, it's back to dull white. I've downloaded half dozen other apps and still nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Cool, but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: These lights definitely provide ambiance to my house, but there are times one or more bulbs will only work when they feel like it. They are also only supported in specific fixtures, one they aren't supported in are ceiling fan sockets. Two of my bulbs work about half of the time, regardless of where they are at. They also turn off randomly. I've tried contacting their support but have only gotten asked if they are in a supported socket. No other correspondence from Phillips has been received. I will probably get more bulbs, years down the road after the bugs have been ironed out. Until then I regret my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Lights won't shut off. Keeps turning back on. Not only one, not only two but three of them!
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Got this setup in no time. The app worked great. Excellent functionality with Google Home and ability to control lights any where. One thing I did not like was not being able to tell which light I had plugged in the socket until I went online. You get three bulbs but from what I can tell, I could not distinguish between the three in the app. The website allows this though. I'll be adding more Philips devices to be certain! As for the brightness, I did not have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kei

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ambient lighting!
customer_reviews.text: I got this pack of lights about two years ago and it started a Philips Hue light addiction! I currently have 22 bulbs in my house! These are amazing for ambient light in a room and seamlessly integrate with Google Home. I absolutely love being able to dim and set the color of the lights, it's so relaxing on the eyes and can really change the feel of the room. The lights aren't the brightest, think a 60W incandescent light bulb kind of brightness, so probably not enough for overhead light. I put them in accent light fixtures, hidden behind furniture, and it creates a wonderful indirect glow to the room!
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Needs some work
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because it gets infuriating when you give a command to Alexa (Amazon Echo) to turn bulbs off and only a few of them go off while others stay on. Smart homes are suppose to make things better and easier, not frustrating so that you have to give the same commands multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Lantana Al

customer_reviews.title: The new light of my life - literally.
customer_reviews.text: How did I exist before these were invented... what a boring existence I was living. I am amazed at how much ambient light influences my mood and my ability to either relax or get things done. The pre-made scenes for these bulbs are a lot of fun, especially since you can move to various parts of the scene image to obtain a new color mix. I'm hooked... buying sets as wedding gifts to keep my reputation as "the cool Aunt".
customer_reviews.author: Katt

customer_reviews.title: Yes, color changeable lights really are that amazing.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great upgrade for any home. You can't really "get" the impact that being able to change the color of your rooms makes until you actually are able to do it. An added bonus, if you have light sensitivity (Yes, I'm talking to my fellow migraine folk), being able to change the color and intensity of light is a gift that I can't even begin to express the magnitude of. Even better, if you have Alexa or Siri sitting around, you can get them to do the work with a simple voice command.
customer_reviews.author: BossMom

customer_reviews.title: Great option for home automation.
customer_reviews.text: I am loving my Hue! It was incredibly easy to set up and start using it. The colors of the bulbs are vivid, and sure there are a lot to select from. I am currently using them in 2 bedrooms and the living room. Plus I bought 3 more soft white bulbs, and obviously can be connected and used with the bridge from this package. I control my lights using Alexa and iOS Homekit, so it is incredibly easy to control my lights staying in or outside my home. Even though it's a little bit more expensive than other options it is really worth it. Totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Shorter life than expected
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are absolutely amazing. My husband wanted them so badly and I finally caved. We have a ceiling fan in the family room with three bulbs, plus a nearby ceiling art light that we linked together. It’s perfect to set moods, use concentrate mode when doing a puzzle, party lights to flash in sync with music, etc. We live everyday to the fullest thanks to these. HOWEVER, it’s been just over a year and the first bulb burned out last month, second burned out yesterday. Granted we use them all the time, but I did not expect to have to replace annually. Would love to see longer lives on this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bacon

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE HUE LIGHTS
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up and the app is super user-friendly. I love these lights so much that I wish I had a lot of overhead lighting so I could use the amazing animations avaiable in their app and the other apps like Thor Lighting. I cannot complain, just by being able to change the color of lighting as the lighting change outside, setting moods in different rooms or have a "sunrise" wake me up in my bedroom (which has made waking up way less painful) is wonderful! Highly recommend to anyone and everyone.
customer_reviews.author: T.Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to a smart home
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights! I installed them and already want more. It was SUPER easy to set up and works great with all my other smart home stuff. Easy to control with the alexa or my phone. If there was one thing I would say is a con, i wish that there was a remote that could connect to the hub that had at least a dimmer, or programmable buttons or something to control the lights without your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith F

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Automation
customer_reviews.text: These make lighting your home so much easier than searching for an outlet or limiting your lighting to what is already wired. I hooked mine up through Alexa and it works very well. The voice activation doesn't do everything and you need to use simple and specific commands, but anything else can be done by the app or a third party app. The first package came with a cracked bulb, but that was replaced extremely quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Mascovich

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These things are the coolest. I can't stop playing with them. They have a long functional life as well which makes them green. You don't have to get these just for the crazy colors, as they allow changes to the quality of white light as well. There some complaints on here regarding glitchiness, but that may be a bi-product of network infrastructure. My experience has been that they work instantly and seamlessly. You don't need Alexa either, Siri can control them just as well. The only thing I feel bad about is what will I do with my old bulbs? They are pretty darn expensive though.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: The hub will save you from frustration
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights. We already had a few of the Hue Lights that were Bluetooth compatible and didn’t need the hub. The BT were REALLY hit and miss being able to control with Hue app and wouldn’t work with Alexa after the first day. I absolutely do not recommend the Bluetooth bulbs. This kit solved all of that. Once we added the hub and the additional lights the whole system works like a charm. Love it and I highly recommend just going with a hub. It will save you endless amounts of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Brown

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: So, where to begin. Would you like to use your device via Alexa... well, a quarter of the time she'll tell you she can't communicate with the device, and half the time she'll say ok, but nothing changes... I hate to say this because Philips was once a great company, but their bulbs are not only overpriced, but seriously crappy from functionality to basic operations. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Love the Philips Hue
customer_reviews.text: I love the Philips Hue. I have (3) color/white and (4) white. They're very easy to install and program. Very easy to add knew bulbs to the system too.These work with Echo (Alexa). When I go to bed at night, I just say "Alexa, turn off all the lights" and bang.....done. Waking up is easier too. I just say "Alexa, turn on bedroom light" and up I am. I've been using the color changing bulbs for Halloween too.
customer_reviews.author: Deek5

customer_reviews.title: Great colors, app and responsiveness - Still overpriced and should be a little brighter.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty amazing lights!! The colors are great and the app works really well. I have these working with Google Home, Logitech Pop switches and a Logitech Harmony remote and everything works great. Edit: I'm loving these so much that I had to go get more from my local target. After adding my new bulb I noticed it was a newer model. Can't help but be a little sad that my week old bulbs are already outdated. Amazon bulb model: lct014. Target model as of 1-20-2018: lct016. No idea if there is much of a difference. Cons: - Still too overpriced - not quite bright enough
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: ... hats in my livingroom and the finished product looks great. I have them set up to a few ...
customer_reviews.text: just installed 6 of these into high hats in my livingroom and the finished product looks great. I have them set up to a few apps on my phone and a Alexa. I also set up the philips dimmer switch. all together they make for a great product. I love being able to change the colors or set themes. great for meditating and relaxing or a party with friends. Having full control over each light individually is great when watching a movie and someone needs to sit at the desk as i can turn off all but the one desk light to not interfere with the screen. all in all 10/10 setup but i wish the bulbs were cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: alek

customer_reviews.title: Well Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Works well although this model does not work with the Google Home. Called Google Customer Service to report the issue. Supposedly they are working on it but have not heard back from them. But that is a Google issue. This works well with the 3rd party apps. Would probably work best with fixtures without shades, or clear shades. Tinted shades really cut down on the effects. But that's not a bulb issue. The system lives up to the claims. And the packaging protected the products well.
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: very good. I use these outside (I know they are ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, very good. I use these outside (I know they are not recommended for this, but they have worked well so far, through a Chicago winter!). My only complaint would be the inability thru the proprietary app to have the lights turn on with a timer to the last color-state. Timers only turn-on to white :( ...3rd party apps are effective and IFTTT works with color-on. Overall, would recommend and purchase again for my specific usage.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason the Phillips Hue has a reputation for the best smart lights. It's because they do! The colors are perfect, the app works great. Installing is very easy, to include setting up the Hue Bridge. If I were to have a complaint, it'd be with the price. With other smart lights selling for $15-25 in color, the Hues are still $50. But if you want the best, I guess that means you have to pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn F Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Super nice and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Love my bulbs. Have had them for a year and they’re awesome. Convenient to use with your smart phone or any smart devices. Just download the app and made a little shortcut on my pull-up menu on my iPhone so the lights are always right there for turning them off or on or dimming them. Also, dropped one from pretty high at one point and it didn’t affect it so that’s nice. Just wish they were slightly more affordable
customer_reviews.author: Jacky Gann

customer_reviews.title: Five-star all the way
customer_reviews.text: You have to respect Philip hue.. it makes you a house better looking very advance and very smart.. very easy installation application works great very simple to.. love that you can haven't connected with Alexa so you can voice command all the light bolts.. one of the best investment I ever did.. now I have them all over the apartment..
customer_reviews.author: Rayson Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Utter garbage. The entire system stopped responding
customer_reviews.text: Utter garbage. The entire system stopped responding. I spent nearly $2k on bulbs and dimmers and nothing works anymore. The app on the iPhone is horrible. This entire set-up was less than a year old before failing. Good luck with Phillip's customer service, it's non existent and they take this garbage back...... What a waste of time and money!
customer_reviews.author: Dicked

customer_reviews.title: Works well with google home
customer_reviews.text: I connected it with my google home and my family is loving it. I got 2 hue dimmer switches with it but we are just saying "Hey Google, turn the living room lights on" or "Hey google, turn off the living room lights" instead of using the dimmer switches. You are also able to say "Hey Google, make the living room blue" and it will make the lights blue.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Work well but gets expensive.
customer_reviews.text: While these lights are pretty expensive, they work well and are very programmable. The Hue app is fairly easy to use and the lights can easily be turned on and off with the app. The app also has the option to know when you are away from the house and when you get back home the lights come back on. I wish the color bulbs were half the price and I would buy more but at $50 each, it gets expensive to fill your house.
customer_reviews.author: unclet

customer_reviews.title: These lights are awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: For years I have been waiting to get some of these lights to find out what all the hype is. Turns out, these things are amazing! Plus you can connect them to Amazon Echo, IFTTT, etc. The Hue App is great as well as some of the other apps out there that can make them flash with music like a color organ. These are awesome and I am excited to buy more when I can.
customer_reviews.author: CoreyTheFro

customer_reviews.title: Great way to start with smart lighting
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend the colored light start kit. Having the different color options is worth the extra expense. Look for a deal though. I wouldn't buy at full price. These go on sale fairly regularly. Caution though: once you start you'll want to replace all the bulbs in your house! And that won't be quick or cheap. But being able to have Alexa or Siri turn everything on and off is life changing.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: adding these was easy. color and brightness seems on par with other ...
customer_reviews.text: I already had a bridge, three 3rd Gen color lights, and an echo dot. adding these was easy. color and brightness seems on par with other brands. I'll probably keep buying these until almost every light in the house has been replaced. being able to set read, relax, and night light on a whim is awesome. I hope Phillips can make a 100watt equivalent soon for utility and hall way areas.
customer_reviews.author: matchstix

customer_reviews.title: I love the variety of color in these lights
customer_reviews.text: I love the variety of color in these lights. I guess time will tell how much they will last, but I'm pretty satisfied. One thing that i want to note is that the light switch needs to be on for these to work. if your power goes off for whatever reason, once it's back on all your lights will be on.
customer_reviews.author: M. Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light automation.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool to automate your lights. Can control with Android devices using OK GOOGLE commands. The hub does not have WiFi so you will need a ethernet port in order to connect it to your network. I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead, splurge and have some fun with your lighting
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, my living room now lives in light. Paired with Alexa I just speak the mood I want and it's done. Easy to setup with the Hue app and Alexa. Couldn't be happier and am now trying to choose where else I can add color to a room. Also in the process of replacing regular lighting with Hue lights. Get it, you'll like it.
customer_reviews.author: MyTGuru

customer_reviews.title: Nice but flawed
customer_reviews.text: I love the lights but they have a mind of their own and one light refuses to turn off, for how expensive they are I expected higher quality and less glitches
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, easy setup and works
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Alexa controls on\off right out of the box, for the color control and scenes you need to enable the Alexa skill "HUE". After that works beautifully. Vary happy with purchase. I also have the lights hooked up with the Wink Hub 2, which will allow control while away. Also have the lights hook up with Siri, which interestingly enough the scenes Siri has are quite different than the scenes Alexa has. So not bad part is trying to figure out which room to get the lights for next :-)
customer_reviews.author: GrandPa

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy this product
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy this product. Hue and the colored lights are great. Got it on prime day which made the price a little more manageable but if you want control of your lighting this is a great starter pack.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Recommend 3rd Gen
customer_reviews.text: Strongly recommend third generation bulbs if the color aspect is important to you. These generate very rich colors and the app control works well. Every now and then, I still get a bulb that 'misses' the signal and requires a second 'tap,' but overall I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: B Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Issues with hardware quality
customer_reviews.text: Functional, but barely. Out of the box, one of the three bulbs was defective and had to be returned for a replacement, and within two months, the bridge failed as well. Considering how many different companies now offer connected lighting solutions, one would think that Philips would have had their hardware dialed in a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: D. Knowles

customer_reviews.title: ... mixed with either the app or a control device like a Google Home have helped my injured roommate immensely ...
customer_reviews.text: These mixed with either the app or a control device like a Google Home have helped my injured roommate immensely with turning the lights off and on. That alone made the purchase worth it. However being able to easily change colors, brightness levels, and setup more complex options clinches the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: annoying to set up but works like a chartm
customer_reviews.text: This a great home starter kit for those with apartments or own a small home. Getting it to work can be annoying but after you set it up it works like a charm. I recommend you take the time to do all the software updates on the device since its crucial for it to work properly.
customer_reviews.author: KARL PERALTA

customer_reviews.title: Not to be used in Norway and or Europe!
customer_reviews.text: As almost all Philips Hue products, they are great. I do not recommend it to be used in Europe, if you buy it from the US. I bought it here and got it shipped to Norway and the voltage didn't match and hence did not work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Yashakur

customer_reviews.title: Hue lights, fun and useful
customer_reviews.text: This was the first starter kit I have bought and since then have added more lights. It all works great. The only issue I have is that sometimes when I turn off the lights, one of the lights will randomly turn back on. I have googled this issue and it is common but there doens't seem to be a fix. Hopefully someday a firmware update will fix it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to plug the bridge directly into your router ...
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to plug the bridge directly into your router and not via a switch or something. Setup was something of a bother based on that fact, but otherwise these are spectacular and an investment you didn't know would provide such a quality of life improvement with the color temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: It's been so much fun setting the mood in the room
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my partner for his birthday. It's been so much fun setting the mood in the room. It's easy to set up and control from your phone. We got a Google mini this past Christmas and it was even easier to connect with that. Now, I can just tell Google to turn on the lights as well. There are many great colors to choose from. You can even upload a picture and they'll pick colors from there. I also love the ability to dim the lights.
customer_reviews.author: SLe

customer_reviews.title: This is cool gadget to have in our home
customer_reviews.text: This is cool gadget to have in our home. We let our kid play with the Hue app and choose the color she wants, it's good for teaching her colors as well, lol! If you buy this, be sure to install IFTTT app on your phone, so you can program it to do things like turning lights off when leaving home or have them blink for a notification, etc. The only reason I am not giving 5 star is the price. IMHO, it's not worth more than $100.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken Bulb in box; very annoying to set up and install.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon should just make their own...I don't understand why we can't have Alexa integration with it out of the box. Why do I need to download yet another app, sign up for yet another account, then try to link yet another account to Alexa? Also: please put some kind of bubble wrap around light bulbs you ship. They're light bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good lights
customer_reviews.text: The product worked fairly well for two years, and I love the control over my lights. Then the bridge suddenly stopped working. Philips Hue customer support eventually sent me new one, but it took a very long time and excessive, repetitive troubleshooting steps.
customer_reviews.author: B. G.

customer_reviews.title: we have bought expansion packs because we are so incredibly satisfied with the product
customer_reviews.text: After having installed this system, and synching with our Amazon Alexa, the convenience is unbelievable! Being able to program certain lights to turn on as we enter the home, and all to turn off when we leave is very convenient. After buying this starter pack, we have bought expansion packs because we are so incredibly satisfied with the product. The light color variations and moods are anything you can imagine.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Neese

customer_reviews.title: Defective bulbs are frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: There are 2 of our 70+ lights in our house that do not always work properly. When you shut off the room, those bulbs will pop back on to 100% with an incandescent temperature. Overall, I love my Hue Bulbs, but the 2 defective ones bring a lot of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ericksen

customer_reviews.title: Best. Buy. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: My intro to Hue. Not disappointed. Maybe I didn't need colored bulbs but still fun. Synced with Alexa. Have Hue lights in MBR, guest room, office, front entry, & laundry room. Will add more!
customer_reviews.author: Carlotta Zee

customer_reviews.title: Lazy persons DREAM purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Uses these all day everyday. Never have to regret ‘forgetting’ turning my lights AGAIN. From the comfort of my bed, loungroom, car, bathroom I can control these lights. Change colours/tones for each lightbulb either collectively or individually. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Had trouble turning them off, great colours and Alexa control
customer_reviews.text: Had some issues turning these lights off. it seems that they randomly turn back on after I turn them off by phone or Alexa. There are whole forums discussing it. It seems to have to do with heat. if you fade the lights off by going to 30% and then turn them off it works fine. Otherwise the colors and operation are awesome. Alexa control is the best and very impressive
customer_reviews.author: David Moodley

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I really love being able to change the color temperature of the lights: bright blue white for cleaning house, warm bright yellow for reading, low yellow-orange for TV watching - and then there are all the fun colors in between and the fact that I can change it with a quick request to Alexa. Perfect for anyone who often finds themselves trapped by a lap cat.
customer_reviews.author: Aura

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Love my hue lights. I have them set up with Alexa so all I have to do is say turn light on dim my lights etc. and believe me, I am technologically challenged. If I can figure it out ANYONE CAN !!😂
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kay Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great lights
customer_reviews.text: Love my Hue lights and the kids love using Alexa to change the colors! Just wish they were a little cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: JeremyW

customer_reviews.title: Like many others, I can't get it to connect
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a ton of random smart lights. Most without a problem. Then the Phillips Hue and surprised that the most well known smart bulb is the worst in terms of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Really great set of lights - the color range is phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: Really great set of lights - the color range is phenomenal, they're fast to react to changes via the app (or via SmartThings), and they're expected to last a very long time. The only complaint is the cost - try to get them on a sale, as the price is prohibitive for many.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Staaden

customer_reviews.title: I love being able to change my lights and I can't ...
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to change my lights and I can't wait to use them in the winter time. I plan to set them to wake me up as if the sun was rising so I no longer have to fumble in the dark thinking I woke up at the wrong time.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: 800 lumen is very weak compared to other smart lights like LifX
customer_reviews.text: 800 lumen is very weak compared to other smart lights like LifX. It takes 2 philips hue smart bulbs to provide a decent amount of light in a small room. The colors are great and thebtransition between colors is very smooth.bb
customer_reviews.author: Basam S.

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy this product
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy this product. Fun with Alexa, brightness levels and great sweep of colors. The wake up alarm lighting works! Products like this have a lot of room to mature and reduce price, but overall worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Hub Won't Connect
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this starter kit and the hub simply won't work. I have tried for the last two days to get this device working. I've switched routers, changed the duplex, reconfigured my firewall and still nothing. At this moment, the kit is simply an expensive set of LED bulbs that cannot do anything. Contacting support has also been a pain and of no help.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love the lights and ability to pick a range of colors. The app works well. I've paired the hub with my Google Home and it's great to be able to control the lights with it. There are also some fun apps that play with the colors. I've already bought 2 additional bulbs to expand my lighting options.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day. Synchs with the Home app so you can customize brightness, color, and time lights to turn on/off at certain times or if both (all) conected phones are not home or one arrives home.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory K.

customer_reviews.title: even for smart bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: The Philips Hue lightbulbs work fantastically. I have them hooked into a Smartthings Link and Google Home, allowing me to control my lights from anywhere. I knocked one star off because the Hue bulbs are expensive, even for smart bulbs.

product_meta.title: Philips Hue White and Color Ambiance A19 60W Equivalent LED Smart Bulb Starter Kit (3 A19 Bulbs and 1 Hub Compatible with Amazon Alexa Apple HomeKit and Google Assistant)
product_meta.description: Limitless possibilities for extraordinary experiences. The Philips Hue white and color ambiance contains 3 bulbs and a hub. It can transform your lighting into an extraordinary experience with colored and white light. Sync lights to your music, TV and games for immersive effects.
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (hub required and included, Alexa device sold separately)
Choose from 16 million colors to turn your everyday lighting into an extraordinary experience. Create light schedules to ease you to sleep, wake you up and ensure you never come home to a dark house

Voice control for Alexa, Apple HomeKit, or Google Assistant, three color A19 LED smart light bulbs plus a Hue bridge that manages up to 50 lights. Expand your system with up to 12 Hue accessories (sold separately), such as a Hue Dimmer Switch, Hue Tap, or Hue Motion Sensor

To install, simply screw in the smart bulbs into your desired light location, download the Hue mobile app and pair your Hue bridge. Control smart-bulb-equipped lamps and overhead lights via the Philips Hue App. Ideal for your favorite ceiling fan lights, floor lamps, table lamps, pendant lights, and more throughout your home
Easily expand your lighting system with accessories (sold separately), such as a Hue Dimmer Switch, Hue Tap, or Hue Motion Sensor. Pair it for automation with your existing Nest or SmartThings system
